page.title: 05VILLAGE SCHOOLING.
page.content: An 1872 Victorian building houses {GARBOLDISHAM SCHOOL,}on a 0.5 acre site, which is 0.875 acres below the minimum required.{TOILETS }are outside, washbasins inside. With no hall, meals cooked on the premises are eaten in classrooms. There are two classrooms plus two demountables. Children are admitted at the start of the year they become five and tranfer to Diss at eleven. In 1985 ninety children drawn from five parishes were set by age into four teaching groups. Staffing is by a Headmistress and three assistants, aided by peripatetic violin and recorder tuition. Swimming is at Thetford. 6 hrs clerical & 9 hrs infant welfare assistance is allowed. {BLO-NORTON SCHOOL}closed many years ago, the children initially bussing to S.Lopham and on its closure last year, to N.Lopham(a steady trend in Norfolk)
